definition: to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity
"knife" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 18)/see also 立刀旁[li4 dao1 pang2]/see also 側刀旁|侧刀旁[ce4 dao1 pang2]
to harvest/to reap/to gather in crops
to cut apart/to sever/to separate/to isolate
to set up an independent regime/to secede/segmentation/division/fragmentation
to resign oneself to part with what one treasures
to get trampled on (idiom)/to be taken advantage of

sentences.english: He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass.
sentences.chinese: 祂必降临，像雨降在已割的草地上。

sentences.english: The famous max-flow min-cut theorem determines the maximum throughput of a network.
sentences.chinese: 最大流最小割定理决定了网络的最大吞吐量。

sentences.english: The polishing agents have minimal cut and finish without any micro marring or dullness.
sentences.chinese: 抛光剂的最小割和完成翻没有任何微型或沉闷。

sentences.english: "How is that?"said the farmer, "You have reaped only half the field. "
sentences.chinese: “那怎么能行呢？”农场主说，“你只割了一半呀。”

sentences.english: Seth ended up cutting his finger while cooking.
sentences.chinese: 赛斯做菜时结果割到自己的手指。

sentences.english: He has bad teeth, and can only eat diced food.
sentences.chinese: 牙齿不太好，要将东西脔割后才能食用。

sentences.english: The paper introduced a new self-propelled brush breaker.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了一种新型自走式割灌机。

sentences.english: Don't always cut me a sword, and gave me wipe the blood chitin.
sentences.chinese: 别总是割我一刀，又给我擦血敷药。

sentences.english: He encountered cutthroat competition in that industry.
sentences.chinese: 他在这产业遇到割喉战。

sentences.english: I think he may have paid me to mow his lawn or something.
sentences.chinese: 我想他可能曾经付钱让我给他割草坪或其他什么的。

sentences.english: I'm cheesed off with having to mow the lawn every three days.
sentences.chinese: 每隔三天就得割草坪真把我烦死了。

sentences.english: The max-cut problem is a standard NP-hard problem in graph graphic theory.
sentences.chinese: 最大割问题是图论中的一个典型的NP困难问题。

sentences.english: He will be like rain falling on a mown field, like showers watering the earth.
sentences.chinese: 他必降临，像雨降在已割的草地上，如甘霖滋润田地。

sentences.english: If it is me, I will never cut appendectomy children.
sentences.chinese: 如果是我，我决不给孩子割阑尾。

sentences.english: A blunt knife draws no blood.
sentences.chinese: 钝刀子割肉割不出血来。

sentences.english: Rice is gathered, cleaned and hulled before being sold.
sentences.chinese: 割，筛清和去壳以后才出售。

definition: to chop up (meat etc)/to chop off (sb's hand etc)
to peel with a knife/to pare/to cut (a ball at tennis etc)
to let blood (Chinese medicine)/to bleed/to stab sb (slang)
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
a saw/to cut with a saw
to slaughter livestock/to govern or rule/to cheat customers/imperial official in dynastic China
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder
to chop/to cut down/to throw sth at sb
